business.headline: Vishal Mega Mart IPO allotment: Online guide to check status. See latest GMPVishal Mega Mart IPO allotment: Investors who applied for the Vishal Mega Mart IPO can check their allotment status on the BSE and KFin Technologies Limited websites.

Mobikwik IPO allotment status: Where to check? GMP, expected listing dateMobikwik IPO allotment status: Investors can check their allotment status online. They can log in to either the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website or the website of Link Intime India Private Ltd.
Sensex, Nifty open lower as IT stocks drag; bearish trends continueThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 279.70 points to 81,853.42, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 74 points to 24,694.30.

Switzerland cancels 'most favoured nation' status to India over Nestle ruling The Swiss government has suspended the MFN clause in its tax treaty with India, potentially leading to higher taxes on Indian companies operating in Switzerland. This move follows a Supreme Court ruling affecting the interpretation of the MFN clause.
Bill Gates to go bankrupt? Tesla CEO Elon Musk explains howElon Musk claims Bill Gates could face bankruptcy over his alleged Tesla short position if the company dominates globally.
Uncovered: Network of suspected scam sites lure 'dabba' tradersIndia Today uncovers a web of suspected scammer sites posing as platforms for the "dabba" stock trade, an illegal practice.

Oh Gary, how could you: Elon Musk mocks US body amid Twitter stock probeA letter from Elon Musk's attorney, Alex Spiro, addressed to outgoing US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) Chair Gary Gensler, alleged that the agency gave Musk a 48-hour ultimatum.
Sensex, Nifty rebound to end higher; FMCG and IT stocks lead recoveryThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 843.16 points to close at 82,133.12, while the NSE Nifty50 added 219.60 points to end at 24,768.30.
EPFO key amendments: Now faster claims and more interest benefits for membersEPFO's amendments focus on reducing delays, quicker claims, and better interest benefits for its members.

Sensex gains 700 points: 3 reasons behind stock market volatility todayStock market rebound: The S&P BSE Sensex was up 730.39 points to 82,020.35, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 192.70 points to 24,741.40, as of 3 PM.

Mobikwik IPO listing: Does GMP suggest strong market debut amid heavy demand?Mobikwik IPO has seen very strong demand among investors and was fully booked within the first hour of opening for subscription.
Sensex back in green: Airtel, HUL, and IT stocks lead market rebound As of 12:52 PM, Sensex was up by 111.46 points to 81,401.42, while Nifty50 gained 12.75 points to 24,561.45.

Vishal Mega Mart IPO last day: Check gmp, subscription. Shoud you subscribe?Vishal Mega Mart IPO has set a price range of Rs 74 to Rs 78 per share. Retail investors need to purchase a minimum of 190 shares in a single lot, requiring an initial investment of Rs 14,820.
Azim Premji, Ranjan Pai to buy a minority stake in Akasa Air: ReportAzim Premji and Ranjan Pai family offices acquired a minority stake in Akasa Air as part of a $130-140 million fundraising round.
Explained: Why a credit score over 800 mattersHigh credit scores boost financial health by offering cheaper loans, and better insurance discounts, amongst others.

Gold, silver price today, December 13, 2024: Precious metals witness dip on MCXGold Price Today December 13, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the lower side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Friday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

Sensex falls 1,000 points: Key factors behind stock market weaknessStock market crash: As of 10:37 AM, the Sensex was down 1,064.37 points to 80,225.59, while Nifty was also struggling below 24,300 losing 332.10 points to 24,216.60.
Sensex, Nifty tank in early trade; inflation relief fails to lift market moodThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 540.09 points to 80,749.87, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 160.35 points to 24,388.35.

Mahila Samman Yojana: Key details about Rs 1000 schemeThe AAP government announced Mahila Samman Yojana, offering Rs 1000 monthly to women in Delhi, with a rise to Rs 2100 if it wins in the upcoming elections.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Nirmala Sitharaman invokes Balraj Sahni's arrest to slam Nehru over Constitution Live UpdatesNirmala Sitharaman invokes Balraj Sahni's arrest to slam Nehru over Constitution

Return Nehru's letters taken by Sonia Gandhi: PM Memorial writes to Rahul GandhiIn a letter to Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, the Prime Ministers' Museum and Library urged him to return Jawaharlal Nehru's personal letters, which were allegedly taken by Sonia Gandhi during the UPA regime.
Tabla maestro Zakir Hussain dies at 73 in US hospital, his family confirmsZakir Hussain, the 73-year-old legendary musician, was admitted to a hospital in San Francisco due to chronic lung disease.

Hero's welcome for D Gukesh: Thousands greet world chess champion in ChennaiGukesh Dommaraju was greeted by thousands of fans when he returned to Chennai on Monday, December 16. A specially-designed car was at the airport to escort the youngest world chess champion to his residence.

Assad's candid photos emerge after ouster, invite ridicule from SyriansSyrians have been fascinated by the background glimpses of a seemingly normal family that held the country in an iron grip and bombed some of their fellow citizens regarded as a threat.

Friend in social sense: Shashi Tharoor's clarification as old Soros post surfacesCongress leader Shashi Tharoor's clarification comes after a 15-year-old tweet resurfaced, where he referred to US billionaire investor George Soros as an "old friend."

Sunil Gavaskar suggests Sachin Tendulkar lesson to struggling Virat Kohli Australia vs India, 3rd Test: Legendary Sunil Gavaskar said Virat Kohli should learn from Sachin Tendulkar's iconic 241 in Sydney to overcome his struggle with deliveries bowled in the line outside the off-stump. Kohli was dismissed for 3 while trying to play an expansive cover drive on Monday in Brisbane.

'Why this approach after being Chief Minister': Congress vs Omar Abdullah on EVMsCongress MP Manickam Tagore asked the Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister to check his facts after Omar Abdullah questioned the Congress's stance on EVMs.

Zakir Hussain: The tabla maverick who made the world go 'Wah, ustad'Tabla legend Zakir Hussain, known for his rhythmic brilliance and global musical collaborations, died in a hospital in the US due to chronic lung disease.

Congress amended Constitution for Indira Gandhi: Nirmala Sitharaman's big attack Live UpdatesRajya Sabha Constitution Debate: In the midst of a tumultuous parliamentary session, the Rajya Sabha is set to hold a two-day debate on the Constitution against the backdrop of a no-confidence motion filed by opposition MPs against Chairman Jagdeep Dhankhar.

Shakti Kapoor was on list of gang that kidnapped 'Welcome' actor: UP PoliceAccording to police, actor Shakti Kapoor was offered Rs 5 lakh to attend an event in UP, but the deal did not get through due to a high advance request. This resulted in the failure of a plan to kidnap Kapoor.

Watch: KL Rahul, Starc distraught after 5th rain interruption in GabbaRain interruptions frustrated KL Rahul and Mitchell Starc during Day 3 of the Brisbane Test, as recurring delays halted play five times, adding to the dismay after India's top-order collapse against Australia's potent bowling attack.

Physics Wallah teacher goes upside down to teach chemistry in class. Viral videoIn the viral video, the Physics Wallah teacher stunned his audience by flipping into an inverted position, balancing his legs on a chair while placing his hands firmly on the floor.

IND vs AUS, 3rd Test Day 3 Live: Rain returns, frustration continues at GabbaIndia (IND) vs Australia (AUS), 3rd Test Day 3 Live Updates and Reactions: Australia captain Pat Cummins dismissed Rishabh Pant for the third time in the series. Earlier, Mitchell Starc got Australia off to a perfect start as he dismissed Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shubman Gill in his first two overs to leave the visitors reeling. Josh Hazlewood also got the big scalp of Virat Kohli as he once again exposed his weakness outside off stump.
Zakir Hussain's last social media post goes viral: Sharing a wonder momentZakir Hussain died on December 16 due to heart-related complications. He was 73.

'Used my son as ATM': Atul Subhash's father accuses daughter-in-law of tortureThe father of the 34-year-old software engineer, who died by suicide in Bengaluru, has called on Prime Minister Narendra Modi, seeking justice for his son and custody of his grandson.

Honda Amaze Review, first drive: The Dzires strongest contender?The third generation of the Honda Amaze packs a punch, it's got a 4-cylinder motor, six airbags as standard and ADAS for the range-topping variants. But it's also still a very reliable and spacious compact sedan. We tell you how it stacks up.

The making of Pune as Maharashtra's dance capitalThe 'Pune Special' edition of art historian Ashish Mohan Khokar's 'Attendance: The Dance Annual of India 2024' brings long-due credit to the city's contribution to this art form

Bangladesh to hold elections in late 2025 or early 2026, says Muhammad YunusBangladesh's interim leader Muhammad Yunus has said that election dates could be fixed by the end of 2025 or the first half of 2026 in a address to the nation.

Isa Guha apologises for Jasprit Bumrah 'primate' comment: Chose wrong wordIND vs AUS: English commentator Isa Guha has apologised for her 'primate' comment on Jasprit Bumrah after the end of Day 2 of the Gabba Test on Sunday, December 15. Bumrah picked up his 2nd 5-wicket haul of the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy series.

Ustad Zakir Hussain, 1951-2024: Life in picsUstad Zakir Hussain, the renowned table maestro, died today, December 15, in the United States due to a heart-related ailment. As the country mourns the loss of the tabla legend, here's a look at his glorious life captured on camera.

Kohli edged and gone: Fans slam pattern after India star flops in BrisbaneVirat Kohli's dismissal pattern persisted as Josh Hazlewood exploited his weakness outside off-stump in the Gabba Test, raising concerns about the star batter's recurring struggles in the same slot.

Public smartphone charging stations can put your data at risk: Everything you need to knowPublic charging stations are convenient, but they are not always safe. If you have other options, such as using your own charger or a portable power bank, it is best to avoid these stations altogether.

Actor Jamie Foxx gets stitches after glass thrown at him at birthday dinnerHollywood star Jamie Foxx sustained injuries after he was hit with a glass on his birthday dinner. He thanked fans and his well-wishers for their speedy recovery.

BB 18: Tajinder Bagga evicted, Vivian Dsena's wife enters the show In the latest episode of Bigg Boss 18, Vivian Dsena's wife, Nouran Aly, entered the Bigg Boss 18 house. Tajinder Bagga was eliminated from the show.

Trailing till 88th min, Man United secure dramatic comeback win vs CityManchester Derby: Ruben Amorim's Manchester United secured a dramatic 2-1 comeback win over Manchester City on Sunday, December 15. Trailing till the 88th minute, Bruno Fernandes and Amad Diallo scored in the final moments to hand the visitors a sensational win at the Etihad.

Amorim drops Rashford, Alejandro Garnacho from Manchester DerbyMarcus Rashford and Alejandro Garnacho were dropped from the Manchester United squad in their Derby vs City. Coach Ruben Amorim commented on the snub and stated that he had been paying attention to every single detail.

Watch: Hojlund, Walker involved in heated clash during Manchester DerbyPremier League: Manchester United's Rasmus Hojlund and Manchester City's Kyle Walker were involved in a heated clash during December 15's Manchester Derby. The duo were handed one yellow card each in the first half.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
